definitions.definition: The mark or impression left by a foot ; a track .
examples: The child watched as his footsteps in the sand were washed away by the waves.

definitions.definition: The indications or waypoints of a course or direction taken.
examples: To walk the footsteps of greatness requires that you start at the bottom of a long stair.

definitions.definition: The sound made by walking , running etc.
examples: The footsteps of the students echoed in the empty hall.

definitions.definition: A step , as in a stair .
examples: The garden path had a small footstep down to the main walkway.

definitions.definition: The distance between one foot and the next when walking; a pace .
examples: Mere footsteps away from the victim lay the murder weapon.

definitions.definition: The act of taking a step.
examples: Take one more footstep towards me, and I'll make you sorry!

definitions.definition: An inclined plane under a hand printing press.

main_definition: The mark or impression left by a foot ; a track .
secondary_definitions: ( by extension , sometimes figurative ) The indications or waypoints of a course or direction taken.
The sound made by walking , running etc.
A step , as in a stair .
The distance between one foot and the next when walking; a pace .
The act of taking a step.
( obsolete ) An inclined plane under a hand printing press.
